column4: do they still have values for volume up/down?.... mine say  0Xae   and  0xb0
yes they have, XF86AudioVolumeDown ..
if you click on the value XF86Audio... and then press the volume key on the keyboard it stays the same?
yes it stays the same
>> do they still have values for volume up/down?.... mine say  0Xae   and  0xb0 -   <--- maybe I should try to get those "default" values back ?
it maybe because we have different keyboards
but I remember that I already had those values as well
? what output does xev give you when hitting for example volume up ?
ya, most 0 ... on the multimedia keys that are responding I have that too (stop, next, etc) but on the 2 not working (volume up/down) I have what I sent you on PM
i found a very old post but it is supposed to work with Logitech iTouch  http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=39004
abit long winded just for two keys lol...   there are tow popular programs  hotkeys seems old..  and also xbindkeys
xbindkeys = http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=79560
sounds good, gonna give it a shot
xbindkeys the later one has a gui app called xbindkeys-config which is supposed to be easy.. i would try the second one first
yepp I'm already into it
bleh... it crashes the app when I try to get a key :o(
any error msg?
ok got it, I had to create a file first, now going to check out if it works
hmm now I just have to enter the command for volumelower and raise, how is the command for that? O_o
seems I found it out: amixer sset PCM 1- unmute
